title: [Evidence]The MMR system seems really broken.Would greatly appreciate if Riot took a look. [Diamond]
body:
TL;DR     -     Just read it lol

I have exactly 150 games of ranked solo queue played in season 5 right now. That's 84 wins and 66 losses, meaning that my win rate is exactly 56% as of right now. 

Two days ago I started at Diamond 5 approximately 50 points, I then proceeded to win every game until 78 points in Diamond 4. This doesn't sound that impressive until you realize that I was gaining either 11, 13, or 15 League Points per win with no exceptions. That amounts to winning 11 straight games in a row. The evidence of this is attached as a picture of my ranked games match history from the League match history website. 

You see that's all fine and dandy until you realize that on my 12th game, which I lost, I also lost 26 LP. That seems incredibly unbalanced and simply unfair. There should no way I should be expected to hold above a 56% win rate and on on streaks that increase my MMR that are anything even near the 11 win streak. 

The next game that I won i got +19 and then -25 the next game that I lost, and then it just went back to being exactly what it was prior. HOW IS THIS FAIR?

If there is anything I'm not doing properly here, let me know, I would greatly appreciate actually being able to climb (and not relying on absolutely insane and  mostly lucky win streaks) the ladder instead of being stuck in Diamond 5 when I was floating around mid diamond 1 last season......




EDIT: 


Some people are arguing that this is fair, yet they don't understand that I'm simply losing twice the LP that I am gaining while maintaining a hugely positive win rate, and going on massive streaks (the 11 win streak isn't the only one, I've gone on 7 and 4 win streaks prior as well, which still didn't result me in getting out of diamond 5, which is plain silly). Winning 56% of the time in a game that's designed for you to maintain a 50% win streak is a lot more significant than it seems, especially with the 150 game sample size, in which I straight up won 18 games more than I have lost. I've never complained about the clamping I experienced in Diamond 1 pre and post Master tier addition, but getting this clamping in diamond 5, where I simply KNOW that I am capable of moving ladder to something higher is just not understandable. It makes no sense to expect a player to win 3 games for every 1 that they lose in order to gain 13 LP, and then still have the risk of losing double what you gained the next game. And again, I don't have a negative win rate, this might have been a good way to allow players to improve, but I'm obviously winning more, just not enough to keep up with the silly standards. 

/rant




EDIT 2:


http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=Dyrus 
117W 89L (Win Ratio 57%)
Challenger 1
475 LP
117W
Riven's Cutthroats

Dyrus's win rate is 1% higher than mine, yet he somehow belongs in mid challenger while I apparently don't deserve Diamond 5. I got placed in Platinum 2 after promos, meaning that even if he got placed in Platinum 1, (the highest you can be placed I'm pretty sure) he should be around a tier higher than me, not 6 tiers higher than me, considering we have a similar amount of games and a similar win rate. CAN SOMEONE STILL SAY THIS MAKES SENSE?

*Oh and thanks ToiletteOfDoom for the statistic.

I found this at riot's website and it helped me understand. A little background of me, i only started playing the game at the end of season 4 just before gnar came out, so a little ignorance is to be expected.

WHY DOES EVERYONE EARN DIFFERENT AMOUNTS OF LEAGUE POINTS?

If your MMR is significantly lower than where the system believes you should be for the division you are in, then your LP gains will be reduced and LP loss will be increased. Alternatively, if your MMR is significantly higher compared to the average your current tier or division, you will gain more LP and lose less. You may even skip promotion series or advance multiple tiers if your MMR significantly outweighs your league.

No. What that means is that if you are playing better than the system believes you to be, they will punish you for it. I'm by no means a diamond player, but I hit mid golds and found my mmr was much lower than the average in that rank. It also explains why the system kept matching me with silver 5's and the like, while I was playing against gold and plat players. The system assumes that everyone you are playing with wants to win, which is a horrible assumption. It also assumes that half of these players won't whine/cry/rage quit the moment one, small thing does not go their way. Yet we all continue to play, so Riot has no need to address any of these issues.

Except that MMR is supposed to adapt. If you get on a winstreak, like OP did, MMR should realize that you are consistantly better than your opponents, in which, iirc, it puts you in a game that it does not believe you can win, to really measure how good you are. This sounds like it happened.

However, in that "unwinnable game" 2 things don't look like they happened. 1) The MMR didn't look like it adjusted at all, and 2) The MMR of the opponents should have made the loss less painful. Neither of which seem to have happened.

Overall, Matchmaker should have a mechanic built in to where it recognizes and tests if it's prediction is way off base. That way, this sort of clamping is limited.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elo_rating_system

Elo, which MMR is based off of, uses statistics to determine your skill level and attempts to place you in a ranking that will give you a 50% chance to beat any given opponent you are matched against.  This is easier to do in chess, which the Elo system was designed for since it is 1v1, but essentially that is how MMR works.

Are you going to argue that a full Bronze team has a real chance against a full Diamond team?  Sure the Bronzies may get lucky here or there, but the Diamond team is going to win WAAAAAAAAY more games than the Bronze ones over a set of games.
